Detailed Description

The DevPackage class holds information about package itself which is used by the installer.

The installer will look for the information contained in a DevPak to see where the contained files should be installed to. It also contains information such as readme and license files.

Member Function Documentation

bool DevPackage::BuildPackage (  const wxString &  FileName,
BuildForm *  buildForm = NULL,
bool  Silent = true
) 
 

Writes a .DevPak file. First it creates a Tar file then it packages this into a bz2 compressed file.

Parameters:
FileName The full file name of the .DevPackage file used to create absolute locations
buildForm A pointer to the form used to display the progress gauge.
Silent A boolean value which deteremines if the guage and messageboxes are used.
Returns:
A boolean value of true if no errors were encountered or false otherwise. NOTE: even on a false value the DevPak may have been built correctly.
See also:
WritePackageFileToString()

const wxString DevPackage::WritePackageFileToString (   ) 
 

Writes a .DevPackage file to a string this is needed since wxFileConfig does not add a space at the start of the file.

See also:
LoadFromPackageFile()
Returns:
A wxString containing the contents of the file
